sen.j: 座布団（ざぶとん）とは、床や畳の上に座る際に、臀部、膝、脚の下に宛がう調度品。
sen.e: A zabuton (Japanese cushion) is an item of furnishing for placing under the legs or bottom when sitting on the floor or tatami.
A zabuton (Japanese cushion) is an item of furnishing for placing under the legs or bottom when sitting on the floor or tatami.
A zabuton (Japanese cushion) is an item of furnishing for placing under the legs or bottom when sitting on the floor or tatami.

sen.j: 厚さが数センチ程、一辺が数十センチ程の、ほぼ正方形をしており、寝具の布団を小さくしたような形状である。
sen.e: A zabuton is a square shape with each side being approximately 40 to 70 centimeters long and several centimeters thick and they are similar in form to futon mattresses only smaller.
A zabuton is a square shape with each side being approximately 40 to 70 centimeters long and several centimeters thick and they are similar in form to futon mattresses only smaller.
A zabuton is a square shape with each side being approximately tens of centimeters long and several centimeters thick and they are similar in form to futon mattresses only smaller.

sen.j: 座布団にはその大きさによって、茶席判（ちゃせきばん、43cm×47cm）、木綿判（もめんばん、51cm×55cm）、銘仙判（めいせんばん、55cm×59cm）、八端判（はったんばん、59cm×63cm）緞子判（どんすばん、63cm×68cm）、夫婦判（めおとばん、67cm×72cm）といった独特な名称がある。
sen.e: There are different names for zabuton of different sizes including chasekiban (43x47cm), momenban (52cmx55cm), meisenban (55cmx59cm), hattanban (59cmx63cm), donsuban (63cmx68cm), and meotoban (67cmx72cm).

sen.j: また日本工業規格では木綿判をSサイズ、銘仙判をMサイズ、八端判をLサイズと定めている。
sen.e: Furthermore, according to the Japan Industrial Standards (JIS), Momenban is designated S size, Meisenban is M size and Hattanban is L size.

sen.j: これらのうち一般に最も広く流通しているのが銘仙判（いわゆる団地サイズ）と八端判（いわゆる旧式サイズ）である。
sen.e: Among these, the most commonly used zabuton are the Meisenban (so-called 'apartment block size') and Hattanban (so-called 'old fashioned size').

sen.j: この日本の日常生活において用いられる用品は、布の袋に緩衝材となる綿やスポンジ等を入れて作られているが、欧米に見られるクッション程に弾力性は求められず、主に床面や畳に直に置かれ、その上に座る事で体温が床面によって奪われるのを防ぐために用いられる。
sen.e: The products used in everyday life in Japan are made by filling cloth bags with cushioning material such as cotton or sponge, and they do not need to have the elasticity often seen in Western cushions, as they are mainly put directly on the floor or tatami and serve to prevent the sitter from becoming cold sitting when on the floor.

The products used in everyday life in Japan are made by filling cloth bags with cushioning material such as cotton or sponge, and they do not need to have the elasticity often seen in Western cushions, as they are mainly put directly on the floor or tatami and serve to prevent the sitter from becoming cold sitting when on the floor.

sen.j: 欧米に見られるクッションとは、前出の求められる弾力性の違いもあって、用法にも一定の差が見られる。
sen.e: Cushions in the West are different not only as they must have the aforementioned elasticity but they are also used in a different way.
Cushions in the West are different not only as they must have the aforementioned elasticity but they are also used in a different way.

sen.j: 座る際に用いられる他、二つに折って簡易の枕にする・乳幼児を寝かせるための小型敷布団の代用品に用いる・落下物から頭を守る防具として用いる等、単純な道具だけに様々な活用方法がある。
sen.e: Zabuton are not only used for sitting,but these simple items are used in a number of ways, including folding in half to make a simple pillow, or as an alternative to a small futon for putting babies to sleep, or as protective gear for protecting the head from falling objects.

sen.j: 近年では日本人の生活様式の変化に伴い、椅子の上に乗せる様式も発達、椅子の形状に合わせて小型の製品も数多く登場している。
sen.e: In recent years, with the changes in lifestyle of Japanese people, zabuton have been made to put on chairs, and many small products created to fit the shape of chairs have come into use.

sen.j: 座布団の成立は鎌倉時代ごろまで遡り、江戸時代中期には現在の形となって庶民にも広く普及したものの、古くは権力者や高僧などの権力の象徴として用いられた経緯がある。
sen.e: The origin of zabuton dates back to the Kamakura Period, and they became the shape we know today in the middle of the Edo Period when they became widely used among ordinary people, although prior to that they had been symbols of the power of high priests and other powerful people.

The origin of zabuton dates back to the Kamakura Period, and they became the shape we know today in the middle of the Edo Period when they became widely used among ordinary people, although prior to that they had been symbols of the power of high priests and other powerful people.

The origin of zabuton dates back to the Kamakura Period, and they became the shape we know today in the middle of the Edo Period when they became widely used among ordinary people, although prior to that they had been symbols of the power of high priests and other powerful people.

sen.j: このため丁寧語として「御座布団」と呼ぶ事も在るが、この場合の御座布団では、宗教的行事などにおいて僧侶等が座る際に用いるための、特別に弾力性に富んでいたり装飾が施された物を指す場合がある。
sen.e: As a result, they are sometimes referred to in the honorific 'go-zabuton', although in this case the term 'go-zabuton' sometimes indicates zabuton used by priests in religious rites and these are decorated and have special elasticity.

As a result, they are sometimes referred to in the honorific 'go-zabuton', although in this case the term 'go-zabuton' sometimes indicates zabuton used by priests in religious rites and these are decorated and have special elasticity.

sen.j: なお鎌倉時代では茵（しとね）と呼ばれる小さな正方形の薄畳の周辺を飾り布で覆った物（今日でも百人一首の絵札に描かれた図の上でこれを見る事ができる）が用いられていた。
sen.e: In the Kamakura Period a small square cushion called a shitone made of tatami and covered with decorative material was used; and pictures of this can be seen today in the picture cards used in the card game called Hyakunin Isshu.

In the Kamakura Period a small square cushion called a shitone made of tatami and covered with decorative material was used; and pictures of this can be seen today in the picture cards used in the card game called Hyakunin Isshu.

In the Kamakura Period a small square cushion called a shitone made of tatami and covered with decorative material was used; and pictures of this can be seen today in the picture cards used in the card game called Hyakunin Isshu.

sen.j: これが後に円座（イグサや藁を綱とし、円形・渦巻状に編み上げた物）のような持ち運びに簡便な道具に代わり、江戸時代中期に布の袋に綿を入れる様式となったとされる。
sen.e: These subsequently evolved into round portable cushions woven from rush or straw into round spiral shapes and then in the middle of the Edo Period zabuton made from cotton stuffed into material bags were created.

These subsequently evolved into round portable cushions woven from rush or straw into round spiral shapes and then in the middle of the Edo Period zabuton made from cotton stuffed into material bags were created.

sen.j: 元来、権力の象徴であった物から派生した長い歴史のある物である。
sen.e: Basically, zabuton have a long history originating in the items used as symbols of power.
Basically, zabuton have a long history originating in the items used as symbols of power.
Basically, zabuton have a long history originating in the items used as symbols of power.

sen.j: この経緯から日本における作法の一環で相手を敬う意図により、現在でも来客に対して必ずといってよいほど提供される。
sen.e: Given this background, it is a matter of etiquette in Japan that even today a guest must be given a zabuton in order to show respect.
Given this background, it is a matter of etiquette in Japan that even today a guest must be given a zabuton in order to show respect.
Given this background, it is a matter of etiquette in Japan that even today a guest must be given a zabuton in order to show respect.

sen.j: 客の側も、座布団を勧められる前にその上に座る行為は礼儀に反するとされることがある。
sen.e: On the guest's part, it is impolite to sit on a zabuton before it is offered by the host.
On the guest's part, it is impolite to sit on a zabuton before it is offered by the host.
On the guest's part, it is impolite to sit on a zabuton before it is offered by the host.

sen.j: 勧められるまでは立ったままか座布団ではなく畳につま先を立てて正座（跪座）すると良いとされる。
sen.e: Until the zabuton is offered, the guest should remain standing or kneel in a semi-kneeling position on the tatami.
Until the zabuton is offered, the guest should remain standing or kneel in a semi-kneeling position on the tatami.
Until the zabuton is offered, the guest should remain standing or kneel in a semi-kneeling position on the tatami.

sen.j: 挨拶を済ませた後、勧められたら礼を述べて座る。
sen.e: After greetings are over and the host offers the zabuton, the guest thanks the host and then sits down.
After greetings are over and the host offers the zabuton, the guest thanks the host and then sits down.
After greetings are over and the host offers the zabuton, the guest thanks the host and then sits down.

sen.j: 座布団は来客に対するもてなしとして用いられる訳だが、これを固辞することも礼を逸するとされる。
sen.e: Zabuton are used as part of the hospitality towards a guest and declining this is a lack of courtesy.
Zabuton are used as part of the hospitality towards a guest and declining this is a lack of courtesy.
Zabuton are used as part of the hospitality towards a guest and declining this is a lack of courtesy.

sen.j: しかし夏などの季節によっては無い方が快適な場合もあり、勧める側も相手の意思を慮って無理に勧めないケースも見られるなど、微妙な運用が求められると考えられる。
sen.e: However, there are situations such as in Summer or other season when it would be better not to use a zabuton, and the host may refrain from insisting on offering a zabuton after considering the

However, there are situations such as in Summer or other season when it would be better not to use a zabuton, and the host may refrain from insisting on offering a zabuton after considering the will of the guest, therefore thoughtful handling is required.
sen.cmt: 訳文が不完全なので再構成しました。

sen.j: 一般的な和室に於ける作法では、座布団の正面は「縫い目の無い（目立たない）一辺」であるとされる。
sen.e: The etiquette for a normal Japanese room is to place the zabuton with the seamless side up.

sen.j: 今日では座布団カバーなどに見られるファスナーが座る者から見て奥に成るのが望ましいだろう。
sen.e: Thesedays, zabuton often have zipped covers and it is preferable to put the zipped side facing behind the person to be seated.

sen.j: なお裏表は中央の糸の房が飛び出している方が表、縫い目しか見えないのが裏であるが、日常の用に足す物では中央の房糸が無いものも見られる。
sen.e: The top and bottom of a zabuton can be distinguished by the seam with the top being the side with the central thread tuft protruding and the bottom being the side on which only the seam can be seen

sen.j: そのような裏表の判別がつかない座布団は日常の用を足す物であるため、来客用と普段用を用意する必要もあるかもしれない。
sen.e: For zabuton on which the top and bottom cannot be distinguished in this way, they are used for everyday use and it may be necessary to have on hand both zabuton for everyday use and zabuton specially for guests.

sen.j: 座る側の作法としては、座布団を足で踏まず、まず座布団の下座側に跪座し、膝を生かして座布団の方へ45度体を向きかえる。
sen.e: Etiquette for sitting on a zabuton includes not standing on the zabuton, and first of all kneel on the zabuton on the side away from the seat of honor and use one's knees to pivot 45 degrees in the direction of the zabuton.

sen.j: 座布団の中央まで膝行し、開き足で足を揃え、正座をする。
sen.e: Move knees to the center of the zabuton, put legs together and kneel.
Move knees to the center of the zabuton, put legs together and kneel.

sen.j: 座布団の横の位置に充分な空きが無い場合は、座布団手前から乗っても構わない。
sen.e: If there is not enough space beside the zabuton, it is all right to sit on the zabuton by approaching from the front.
If there is not enough space beside the zabuton, it is all right to sit on the zabuton by approaching from the front.

sen.j: なお座布団の位置を手で動かすと、どうしても相手の用意の悪さを論うように見えるため、本来きちんと揃えられた座布団を座る位置にあわせて動かすのは避けた方が良いかも知れない。
sen.e: Moving the position of the zabuton appears to criticise the preparation of the host, so it is a good idea to avoid moving a zabuton which has been originally properly placed in position.

sen.j: 案内役の誘導に従って、座布団の置かれた位置に座るのが望ましいだろう。
sen.e: It is preferable to sit in the position the zabuton has been placed in accordance with the invititation of the host.
It is preferable to sit in the position the zabuton has been placed in accordance with the invititation of the host.

sen.j: なお室内の座る位置に関しては、一般的に出口に近い方ほど地位が低い者の場所（下座）とされ、奥の床の間飾りなどがある場所が上座となる。
sen.e: Regarding the positions for sitting within a room, generally the closer to the door, the lower the rank of the person and the position in the room away from the door and near a decorative feature such as an alcove called a Tokonoma is the place of honor.

sen.j: 通常そのような上下関係がある席では、目上の者が座るまで待って座布団に座るのが一般的であるが、目上の者が遅れて来る場合は必ずしもその限りではない。
sen.e: Usually if there is a hierachical relationship in the seating arrangements, it is common to wait until the person in the place of honor or other superiors have sat before sitting down, however this may not necessarily be the case if the person is arriving late.

sen.j: なお無闇に謙って迎える側の誘導を無視して下座に陣取ると出口が近い事もあり「おまえの所は不快なのですぐ帰る」という意思表示に取られかねないため、注意が必要である。
sen.e: Indiscreetly ignoring the invitation of the host and sitting in a seat nearer the door may be interpreted as a sign that you do not appreciate the host's locale and wish to leave soon so care needs to be taken.

sen.j: 立つ際には、座る時と逆の順序で立つ。
sen.e: Standing should be done in the opposite way to sitting.

sen.j: この時も座布団を足で踏んではいけない。

sen.j: 座布団は座る道具であるため、基本的には椅子の座席同様、その上に立つ行為は「あまり美しくない」といえよう。
sen.e: A zabuton is for sitting on, so let's just say that standing on one is much like standing on a chair, and this is not aesthetically pleasing.

sen.j: 勿論、あまり堅苦しくない席ではこのような配慮は必要無いが、普段から練習しておくと自然と身に付いて大事な席での失敗が避けられると思われる。
sen.e: Of course, in an informal situation this kind of consideration is not necessary however practicing everyday will help you learn naturally and so avoid making mistakes when it is really important.

sen.j: 尋常ならざる謝意や謝罪の意を表す場合、着座している座布団を外した上で平伏することが行われることもある。
sen.e: When showing extraordinary appreciation or apology, sometimes a person removes a zabuton before prostrating themselves on the floor.

sen.j: 座布団は概要で述べたとおり、その単純な構造ゆえに様々に応用される。

sen.j: 近年では日本人の生活が欧米化し、畳の上に座る機会が減り、椅子に座る機会が増えた訳だが、特に座席や背もたれの弾力性が足りない場合や、座席が冷たい場合などに、椅子の機能を追加する意図でこの座布団を用いるケースが見られる。
sen.e: In recent years the lifestyle of Japanese people has become westernized, and the opportunities to sit on tatami have become fewer while the use of chairs has increased however zabuton are often used to supplement the function of chairs particularly if the seat or backrest is hard or the seat is cold.

sen.j: また第二次世界大戦末期に日本全土が大規模な空襲に見舞われたが、これへの対処策として2枚の座布団を組み合わせた防空頭巾で頭部や肩を落下物の衝突から保護した。
sen.e: In addition, towards the end of WWII, Japan was subject to large scale air raids nationwide and one protective measure taken was to use two zabuton together make an 'air raid hood' to protect the head and neck from falling objects

In addition, towards the end of WWII, Japan was subject to large scale air raids nationwide and one protective measure taken was to use two zabuton together make an 'air raid hood' to protect the head and neck from falling objects

sen.j: 水に浸すことで頭部を火災などの熱から守ることも出来たこの防空頭巾は、地震や火災などの災害時における防災頭巾として1970年代に復活した。
sen.e: These 'air raid hoods' could be soaked in water to protect the head from fire and heat and they were reintroduced in 1970 as a disaster prevention hood for protection in disasters such as earthquakes and fires.

These 'air raid hoods' could be soaked in water to protect the head from fire and heat and they were reintroduced in 1970 as a disaster prevention hood for protection in disasters such as earthquakes and fires.

These 'air raid hoods' could be soaked in water to protect the head from fire and heat and they were reintroduced in 1970's as a disaster prevention hood for protection in disasters such as earthquakes and fires.

sen.j: 今日この防災頭巾には丈夫な難燃性合成繊維ものが普及しており、また色彩も目立つ橙黄色のものが主流となっている。
sen.e: These days air raid hoods with tough, fire resistant synthetic fiber are common and the colors are mainly bright orange-yellow.
These days air raid hoods with tough, fire resistant synthetic fiber are common and the colors are mainly bright orange-yellow.
These days disaster prevention hoods with tough, fire resistant synthetic fiber are common and the colors are mainly bright orange-yellow.
sen.cmt: air raid hoods → disaster prevention hoods

sen.j: 大相撲
sen.e: Grand Sumo
Grand Sumo
Grand sumo tournament

sen.j: 大相撲で関取が土俵下に控える時に使う座布団。
sen.e: A zabuton used by ranking sumo wrestlers in the Grand Sumo tournament when they are waiting beside the ring.
A zabuton used by ranking sumo wrestlers in the Grand Sumo tournament when they are waiting beside the ring.
A zabuton used by ranking sumo wrestlers in the Grand Sumo tournament when they are waiting beside the ring.

sen.j: 幕内力士は専用の控え座布団を持つことが認められており、鮮やかな色の下地にはそれぞれの四股名が染め抜かれている。
sen.e: Top division wrestlers are permitted to have their own special zabuton and they have their ring names dyed on colorful material.
Top division wrestlers are permitted to have their own special zabuton and they have their ring names dyed on colorful material.
Top division wrestlers are permitted to have their own special zabuton and they have their ring names dyed on colorful material.

sen.j: 特に厚めにしつらえられた「夫婦判」（いちばん大きい型）を使い、これを二つ折りにして座るのが伝統。
sen.e: They especially use the thicker Meotoban zabuton which are the biggest zabuton, and it is traditonal to fold them in half before sitting on them.
They especially use the thicker Meotoban zabuton which are the biggest zabuton, and it is traditonal to fold them in half before sitting on them.
They especially use the thicker Meotoban zabuton which are the biggest zabuton, and it is traditonal to fold them in half before sitting on them.

sen.j: 座布団の舞
sen.e: Zabuton throwing
Zabuton throwing
Zabuton throwing

sen.j: 大相撲で横綱が格下の力士に負けたときに、横綱への落胆と勝った力士への称賛の意味を込めて、桟敷席の観客が座布団を土俵に向かって投げる行為。
sen.e: If a yokozuna wrestler loses to a lower ranked wrestler in a Grand Sumo tournament, the audience members sitting in the ringside seats throw their zabuton towards the ring to express disappointment with the yokozuna and praise the wrestler who won.

If a yokozuna wrestler loses to a lower ranked wrestler in a Grand Sumo tournament, the audience members sitting in the ringside seats throw their zabuton towards the ring to express disappointment with the yokozuna and praise the wrestler who won.

If a yokozuna (grand champion) loses to a lower ranked wrestler in a Grand Sumo tournament, the audience members sitting in the ringside seats throw their zabuton towards the ring to express disappointment with the yokozuna and praise the wrestler who won.

sen.j: 以前は金星 (相撲)を提供してしまったときのみにこれが見られたが、最近では幕内に負けてもほぼ例外なくこれが起るようになった。
sen.e: Originally this only happened when rank-and-file wrestlers in sumo's highest division won against a yokozuna however recently it happens almost without exception even if the yokozuna loses to a ranking wrestler in the senior division.

Originally this only happened when rank-and-file wrestlers in sumo's highest division won against a yokozuna however recently it happens almost without exception even if the yokozuna loses to a ranking wrestler in the senior division.

Originally this only happened when rank-and-file wrestlers in sumo's highest division won against a yokozuna however recently it happens almost without exception even if the yokozuna loses to a ranking wrestler in the senior division.

sen.j: また、ごく稀に逆に横綱が勝って座布団を投げられたケースも見られる。
sen.e: Moreover, conversely it occasionally happens that zabuton are thrown even if the yokozuna wins.
Moreover, conversely it occasionally happens that zabuton are thrown even if the yokozuna wins.
Moreover, conversely it fairly infrequently happens that zabuton are thrown even if the yokozuna wins.

sen.j: ただし危険防止のため公には禁止されている。
sen.e: However, the practice is officially prohibited for safety reasons.
However, the practice is officially prohibited for safety reasons.
However, the practice is officially prohibited for safety reasons.

sen.j: 落語
sen.e: Rakugo
Rakugo
Rakugo (traditional comic storytelling)

sen.j: 落語で、最も簡略にして最も大切な舞台装置が、高座の中央にぽつんと置かれた座布団である。
sen.e: In Rakugo, the most simple and most important piece of stage equipment is the lone zabuton sitting in the middle of the stage.
In Rakugo, the most simple and most important piece of stage equipment is the lone zabuton sitting in the middle of the stage.
In Rakugo, the most simple and most important piece of stage equipment is the lone zabuton sitting in the middle of the stage.

sen.j: 噺家が大きい仕草を交えた語りをしても安心して座っていられるよう、高座の座布団にも一番大きい「夫婦判」が使われている。
sen.e: The zabuton used on stage is the largest size zabuton, or Meoto zabuton so that the rakugo storyteller can feel comfortable even when telling a story using a lot of gesturing.
The zabuton used on stage is the largest size zabuton, or Meoto zabuton so that the rakugo storyteller can feel comfortable even when telling a story using a lot of gesturing.
The zabuton used on stage is the largest size zabuton, or Meotoban so that the rakugo storyteller can feel comfortable even when telling a story using a lot of gesturing.

sen.j: 「大喜利 (笑点)」の重ね座布団
sen.e: Oogiri (shoten) Pile of Zabuton
Oogiri (shoten) Pile of Zabuton
Ogiri' (shoten) Pile of Zabuton

sen.j: 長寿番組『笑点』（日本テレビ）の中でも人気のコーナーが、設問に対して噺家が機智に富んだ回答で笑いの妙を競う「大喜利」。
sen.e: Oogiri is the name of a popular segment on the long-running television show 'Shoten' broadcast by Nihon TV, in which a rakugo storyteller must give a witty reply to a question and get some laughs.
Oogiri is the name of a popular segment on the long-running television show 'Shoten' broadcast by Nihon TV, in which a rakugo storyteller must give a witty reply to a question and get some laughs.
Ogiri' is the name of a popular segment on the long-running television show "Shoten" broadcast by Nihon TV, in which rakugo storytellers must give a witty reply to a question and get some laughs.
sen.cmt: シングルクォートダブルクォートstory teller → storytellers

sen.j: 秀逸な回答をした者に得点のかわりに与えられるのが座布団で、これを10枚獲得すると豪華賞品がもらえる。
sen.e: The storyteller with the best reply is given not points but zabuton, and when they collect ten zabuton they receive a luxurious prize.
The storyteller with the best reply is given not points but zabuton, and when they collect ten zabuton they receive a luxurious prize.
The storyteller with the best reply is given not points but zabuton, and when they collect ten zabuton they receive a luxurious prize.

sen.j: 逆に下らない回答をすると座布団を取り上げられる。
sen.e: Conversely, if a boring reply is given a zabuton may be taken away.
Conversely, if a boring reply is given a zabuton may be taken away.
Conversely, if a boring reply is given a zabuton may be taken away.

sen.j: 10枚重ねた上に座っても倒れてしまうことがないよう、この座布団には薄めでしかも重めに特注したもの（中綿が通常の倍近く詰められ、さらに小さな座布団を1枚入れている。
sen.e: In order to prevent the storyteller sitting on ten zabuton from falling over, the zabuton are specially made and are thin but heavy, with nearly twice the amount of cotton stuffing as well as another smaller zabuton inside.

In order to prevent the storyteller sitting on ten zabuton from falling over, the zabuton are specially made and are thin but heavy, with nearly twice the amount of cotton stuffing as well as another smaller zabuton inside.

In order to prevent the storyteller sitting on ten zabuton from falling over, the zabuton are specially made and are thin but heavy, with nearly twice the amount of cotton stuffing as well as another smaller zabuton inside.

sen.j: このため新品でも1枚2キロ。
sen.e: As a result, even a new zabuton weighs two kilograms.
As a result, even a new zabuton weighs two kilograms.
As a result, even a new zabuton weighs two kilograms.

sen.j: 使っていくうちに湿気を吸って3キロ近くなる）が使われている。
sen.e: The more the zabuton is used, the more moisture it absorbs and some zabuton in use may weigh around three kilograms.
The more the zabuton is used, the more moisture it absorbs and some zabuton in use may weigh around three kilograms.
The more the zabuton is used, the more moisture it absorbs and some zabuton in use may weigh around three kilograms.

sen.j: 大きさも安定性を増すため67cm×77cmと通常の「夫婦判」より横幅が長く取ってある。
sen.e: The size is also a little wider than the usual Meoto zabuton, measuring 67cmx77cm, in order to further improve the stability.
The size is also a little wider than the usual Meoto zabuton, measuring 67cmx77cm, in order to further improve the stability.
The size is also a little wider than the usual Meotoban, measuring 67cmx77cm, in order to further improve the stability.

sen.j: なお、「TVおじゃマンボウ」（日本テレビ）でこの座布団を16枚積んで座っている様子が放送されている。
sen.e: On the television program 'TV Ojamanbo' broadcast by Nihon TV, a person has been shown sitting on sixteen of these zabuton.
On the television program 'TV Ojamanbo' broadcast by Nihon TV, a person has been shown sitting on sixteen of these zabuton.
On the television program 'TV Ojamanbo' broadcast by Nihon TV, a person has been shown sitting on sixteen of these zabuton.

sen.j: なお、この番組の浸透のため、一般の会話でも面白いことを言うと「座布団1枚!」とかの表現を見ることがある。
sen.e: Moreover, due to the influence of this television program, the expression 'have a zabuton!' can be heard in ordinary conversation when someone says something funny.
Moreover, due to the influence of this television program, the expression 'have a zabuton!' can be heard in ordinary conversation when someone says something funny.
